plugins.name: Variable Find & Replace Across Libraries
plugins.description:
Are you tired of manually updating variables one by one across your Figma files? This plugin is the powerful solution you've been waiting for, saving design teams hundreds of hours of tedious work.


‚ú® Key Features

  1. One-Click Variable Replacement ‚Äî Replace any variable throughout your entire page instantly
  2. Comprehensive Variable Support ‚Äî Works with dimensions, strokes, fills, shadows, fonts, and more
  3. Style Integration ‚Äî Even replace the variable in styles that use your target variables, ensuring complete system consistency
  4. Multiple Library Sources ‚Äî Select variables from both local and team shared libraries
  5. Lightning-Fast Performance ‚Äî Process thousands of elements in seconds
  6. Design System Friendly ‚Äî Perfect for design system refactoring and maintenance


üîÑ How It Works

  1. Select the variable you want to replace
  2. Click "Find" to target all its occurrences on page
  3. Choose a new variable from your local or team library
  4. Click "Replace" and watch the magic happen
  5. That's it! All instances are updated instantly


Don't let variable replacement slow down your design workflow. Install now and transform how you work with Figma variables!
plugins.tagline: Instantly replace all targeted variables on your page with one click, saving you tons of time!

plugins.name: Accessibility Simulator
plugins.description:
Explore and understand accessibility considerations in your designs through experimental simulations. This plugin offers three key features:


  1. Vision Simulator: Test how your designs appear to users with different visual conditions including cataracts, glaucoma, deuteranopia, and diabetic retinopathy.
  2. Motor Control Analysis: Evaluate interaction accessibility by analyzing target sizes and click difficulty based on standard guidelines.
  3. Cognitive Load Analysis: Assess visual complexity and text readability to optimize user comprehension.


How to use:

  1. Select any element in your design
  2. Choose a simulation type
  3. Review the analysis and suggested improvements
  4. Use insights as a starting point for further accessibility testing


Limitations:

  1. Simulations are approximate and may not perfectly reflect actual user experiences
  2. Should not replace professional accessibility audits
  3. Best used during the design process for early feedback and learning


Important note: This is an experimental tool intended for early-stage testing and learning. Results should not be used as a final assessment - always validate your designs with professional accessibility testing and real user feedback.
plugins.tagline: Vision simulation, Motor control analysis and Cognitive load analysis initial experimental simulator

plugins.name: Export variables to Github repository
plugins.description:
Introduction


Export all Figma variables as .json file to a Github repository.

All variables collections are exported.


Variables json structure is mapped from the getLocalVariablesAsync api function as following:

{
id: variable.id,
name: variable.name,
type: variable.resolvedType,
values: variable.valuesByMode
}


Plugin settings


Username: the username of the repository owner.

Repository: the name of the repository.

Path: the folders path where to save the variables file. Folder and sub folders must already exist in your repo.

File name: the name of the variables file.

Access Token: the Github access token needed to push on your repository. The access token must have read and write permission for Contents. Check the documentation on how to create an access token.

Commit message: add a short comment related to the modifications done.


All the settings are mandatory but the commit message.


Plugin functionalities


Save & Export: save the settings and push the variables file to your repository.

Download: locally download the variables file.

Reset settings: reset the plugin settings to default.
plugins.tagline: Export variables to Github repository

plugins.name: Drag & Drop FPO
plugins.description:
Drag & Drop FPO : Anywhere in your layout


As the name suggest, drag & drop the FPO marker over the content or images in your layout that are placeholder content. It helps communicate within the internal team or the clients or dev team, as to which content will be updated in future.


If your designs are in Auto-Layout, the dropped "FPO" will be positioned "ABSOLUTE" and won't interfere within the set auto-layout.


"FPO" placed over the frame without the auto-layout will appear on top-left corner.


Feel Free to reach out with any Feedback, thanks for using the plugin !
plugins.tagline: Drag & Drop FPO anywhere in your layout

plugins.name: [QUON] Design Tools
plugins.description: This tool was developed to address the "little annoyances" in design work. Its main features include the ability to adjust the selected object to a specific ratio, split specific shapes, and round off decimal points. Additionally, it has functions to split text line by line or at each blank line, and to remove all line breaks. Moreover, within the scope of user-defined groups or frames, you can easily select elements based on various combinations of common properties such as width, fill, and position.
plugins.tagline: Streamline design with ratio adjustments, shape splitting, text tools, and property-based selection.

plugins.name: MarketProvider Plugin
plugins.description:
The "MarketProvider Import" plugin provides an easy way to import product information from the "MarketProvider" PIM system into your Figma projects. This tool allows for seamless transfer of various product attributes, such as text and images, enabling effortless integration and content updates without leaving the Figma workspace.


Advantages:

  1. Data import in a few clicks: Save time and effort by quickly transferring product information to Figma, enabling instant design work.
  2. Support for different attributes: The "MarketProvider Import" plugin ensures full transfer of textual data and images while preserving their quality and format.
  3. User-friendly: With a simple interface, the plugin is designed for comfortable integration into your creative process.


Thank you for your interest in our plugin. If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our support team.


Best regards,

The "MarketProvider Import" Team

plugins.name: Better Duplicate
plugins.description:
Duplicate selected frames to the right or downwards. Frames would be automatically arranged in a row or column based on their positions.


While iterating on a new design I felt a lot of friction from the native frame duplication process: it's hard to quickly duplicate frames and make sure they end up exactly where I want. Additionally, they can only be duplicated horizontally on canvas while I frequently add vertical iterations as well. Native duplication also doesn't work with multiple frames. To avoid needing to manually arrange frames while iterating quickly I created this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames right or down using smart algorithms for their placement

plugins.name: ZapCode
plugins.description:
Ever dreamed of turning your Figma designs into glorious, ultra-responsive code with just a couple of clicks? Well, dream no more, friend‚Äîthis plugin is your magic wand!


Here‚Äôs the game plan:


  1. Select your Figma layer: Want the entire page? Click it. Only need a nifty component? Select it.
  2. Press the ‚ÄúZap-it‚Äù Button: Sit back, sip your coffee, and let our AI do its super-brainy thing.
  3. Download your freshly minted code: HTML, CSS, Angular, and more! Plus, assets are included.
  4. Name your components: Enter your preferred component names, and we‚Äôll use them to create files tailored to your needs.
  5. Success! You just dodged hours of hand-coding. Cue confetti!


New Features You‚Äôll Love:


Angular Tech Stack: Now supporting Angular with advanced settings to fit your specific needs.


Tailwind & Bootstrap Support: For HTML/CSS conversion, you can now choose between Tailwind and Bootstrap frameworks.


Custom Component Naming: Add a personal touch to your files by naming components as per your preference.


Oh, and don‚Äôt forget:


  1. Every day, you‚Äôll get 5 free Zapcoins for your code generation adventures. Need more? You can now buy Zapcoins directly within the plugin via Buy Me a Coffee.
  2. Redeem Zapcoins with tokens sent to your email and unlock premium features.
  3. First, click the ‚ÄúAPI Key‚Äù button to feed our AI (we use Anthropic‚Äôs API)‚Äîyour key is stored securely in Figma's storage. Converted files are also saved there for safekeeping. No shady external servers, promise!
  4. No need to enter API key while using free Zapcoins, Gemini will be used to convert your designs.


Now go forth, fearless designer, and code all the things‚Ä¶without actually writing code. Because that‚Äôs how we roll! üöÄ
plugins.tagline: Go Design To Code with One Click.

plugins.name: Lingoport Localyzer
plugins.description:
Fast-track your FIGMA design work for translation via Lingoport‚Äôs FIGMA connector to Localyzer. Lingoport provides a full range of continuous localization solutions. Translate now with an automated process, whether with humans or machines, so that localization moves at the speed of development. Use machine translation or pseudo-localize so you can immediately see how your U/I will look in target languages. For more information, visit https://lingoport.com.



Getting Started

To get started, you will need a Lingoport Command Center API user account and at least one project set up with Localyzer. To set up an account, please contact us.


Launch The Plugin

1. Open your Figma design file.

2. Go to Plugins and select Lingoport Localyzer.

3. Log in with your Command Center username, generated API token, and URL to the server you are connecting to.

4. Select one of your existing Command Center projects to connect to the Figma file.

6. Select "Finish Setup" to save the selected project.


Using The Plugin

When setup is complete, you can start using the plugin by exporting selected strings to your saved Command Center project. Once translations are complete on Command Center, you can translate your Figma designs into your target languages.



Need Help?

Please contact us at figma@lingoport.com for any questions or assistance.

accepted.name: Lingoport
accepted.description: Since 2001, Lingoport has been helping companies internationalize and localize their software using our suite of products and expert i18n services.

plugins.tagline: Easily translate Figma designs (strings) into different languages.

plugins.name: StuDocreator
plugins.description:
A small text generator for books, courses and documents.


To generate this text, simply have text fields selected and click on whichever data you want to generate.


Example: If you want to generate a Document Title, select a text field and click on the 'Title' button under the 'Documents' section.

If you want to generate a Book Author, select a text field and click on the 'Author' button under the 'Books' section.


If you would like to generate all the data of a section, for example the Title, Course and Institution of a Document, you need to have three text fields selected each named appropriately. The fields should be named by section and type, so section_type


Example. Select 3 text fields named

  1. document_title
  2. document_course
  3. document_institution

And click on the Document button in the Documents tab. This will generate all information into these text fields.

plugins.name: Markly - Paste/Copy from Markdown
plugins.description:
Markly makes it effortless to bring Markdown into your Figma designs or export Figma text layers as Markdown. Paste or type Markdown to instantly create styled text layers, copy selected layers as clean Markdown, and map Markdown elements to your local text styles for brand consistency.


The plugin has three command launcher:

  1. Convert from Markdown: Paste or select Markdown text and generate Figma layers.
  2. Copy as Markdown: Export Figma text layers as ready-to-use Markdown.
  3. Match Styles: Map headings, lists, and links to your custom Figma text styles.


Includes live preview, dark/light theme support, and an intuitive manual copy UI for full clipboard compatibility.

plugins.name: Figiconizer - Auto-Resizes & Organizer Icons
plugins.description:
Figiconizer ‚Äì Simplify Icon Organization in Figma!

Figiconizer is a handy plugin designed to help you quickly and efficiently organize icons in Figma. Whether you're working with individual icons or creating an entire icon set, Figiconizer automatically arranges your icons and resizes them to fit your desired dimensions.


How Does It Work?

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Run the Figiconizer plugin.
  3. Enter your preferred frame size and padding value.
  4. Figiconizer automatically arranges your icons proportionally within the frames.


Why Choose Figiconizer?

  1. Fast and Efficient: No more manually resizing icons one by one. Create a perfectly organized icon set in seconds.
  2. Customizable Settings: Set your own frame size and padding values to ensure your icons look exactly the way you want.
  3. Tidy Workspace: Keep your icons neatly organized, speeding up your design workflow.


Who Is It For?

  1. Designers creating icon sets.
  2. Anyone who wants a clean and consistent workspace in Figma.
  3. UX/UI designers looking to speed up their prototyping process.


With Figiconizer, organizing icons has never been easier! Try it now and save time on your Figma projects. üçªüéâ


‚òïÔ∏è Buy me a coffee

plugins.name: Paper (Beta)
plugins.description:
The Paper plugin is a simple plugin designed to help users efficiently take and organize notes directly within their Figma files. Whether you're collaborating on a design project, documenting ideas, or adding context to your work, this plugin provides a seamless way to capture and manage your thoughts without leaving the Figma environment.


Key Features:


Heading Styles: Easily structure your notes with customizable heading styles, making it easy to organize your content.

Text Formatting: Use bold, italics, and other text formatting options to emphasize important information.

To-Do Lists: Stay on top of tasks with built-in to-do list functionality, helping you track progress and prioritize work.

Bulleted and Numbered Lists: Organize your notes with clean, easy-to-read lists for quick reference.

Privacy-Focused: All data remains within the plugin, ensuring that no information is sent outside your Figma file. Your notes are securely stored and only accessible to you and your collaborators.


Future updates will continue to expand on these features, offering even more tools to enhance your note-taking experience within Figma.


Perfect for designers, developers, and teams who need a flexible and private note-taking solution integrated directly into their design workflow!
plugins.tagline: A dead simple note taking plugin for figma

plugins.name: Interactive Input Fields & Form Prototyping with MagicInput
plugins.description:
Turn any static design into a fully interactive, keyboard-driven prototype, without writing a single line of code

---

MagicInput automates the creation of input fields in your Figma prototypes by:


  1. üîÅ Cloning a base input component or instance
  2. üîó Binding values to Figma Variables (value, length, placeholder visibility)
  3. ‚å®Ô∏è Adding keypress-based reactions for typing, backspace, and more
  4. üéØ Enabling click-to-focus behavior
  5. üöÄ Generating full keyboard logic with conditional visibility
  6. üßº Cleaning up unused variables automatically

---

Whether you're building forms, authentication flows, or search UIs, MagicInput helps simulate realistic input behavior, directly inside Figma.

- Supports:

a‚Äìz, A‚ÄìZ, 0‚Äì9, space, backspace, escape, and special characters (!@#$%^&*()_+, etc.)

Perfect for:

  1. UX demos with real input behavior
  2. Usability testing without dev handoff
  3. Interactive form mockups

plugins.name: Contrast checker
plugins.description:
Contrast Checker is a Figma plugin designed to help designers ensure their designs are accessible by automatically analyzing text and background color contrast within selected frames. The plugin checks for compliance with accessibility standards, highlights potential issues, and provides detailed reports, enabling you to create inclusive and user-friendly designs effortlessly.



What the Plugin Does


‚Ä¢Automatic Contrast Analysis: The plugin scans selected frames to identify text elements and their background colors, calculating the contrast ratio between them.

‚Ä¢Accessibility Compliance: It checks whether the contrast ratios meet the WCAG (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines) standards, specifically for normal and large text.

‚Ä¢Detailed Reports: After analysis, the plugin generates a comprehensive report that highlights any text elements that do not meet the required contrast ratios, providing actionable feedback.

‚Ä¢Issue Highlighting: Users can locate specific elements with contrast issues directly within their design by using the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù feature.

‚Ä¢Ignore Option: If certain elements are intentionally designed with lower contrast, users can choose to ignore those specific issues.



How to Use the Plugin


1.Select a Frame: Start by selecting the frame or frames within your Figma document that you want to analyze.

2.Run the Plugin: Launch the Contrast Checker plugin. It will automatically start analyzing the selected frame(s).

3.View the Report: Once the analysis is complete, view the detailed report generated by the plugin. This report will list all the text elements within the frame(s) and indicate whether they meet the required contrast ratio.

4.Address Issues: Use the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù button to find and fix elements with contrast issues in your design.

5.Manage Issues: Optionally, ignore any issues that you don‚Äôt need to fix by using the ‚ÄúIgnore‚Äù feature.



Limitations


‚Ä¢Text Detection: The plugin only analyzes visible text elements and solid background colors. It may not correctly analyze text with gradient backgrounds, images, or complex overlays.

‚Ä¢Performance: The plugin performs best on smaller frames or a limited number of selected frames at once. Analyzing very large frames with numerous text elements may take longer.

‚Ä¢Customization: Currently, the plugin does not support custom contrast thresholds beyond the WCAG standards, and it does not provide options for customizing the analysis parameters.


By using the Contrast Checker, designers can ensure their work is accessible, improving the overall inclusivity of their designs.
plugins.tagline: boost accessibility w/ seamless contrast checks ‚Äî ensure every design is inclusive & user-friendly!

plugins.name: List Texts, Select Text
plugins.description:
Keep your text layer names tidy and unique.


Easily list all of the text elements on the current page by their Frame and Element name. Click on the name to select that text element to edit it.


Getting Started:

  1. The plugin will automatically display the current page you are on and list all text elements on that page
  2. The list format is [Closest Parent Frame Name]::[Text Element Name]
  3. Click on an item in the list to easily select that item
  4. This plugin will also display a "DUPE" warning for elements that have the same name


This plugin was built to help maintain unique key names for Lokalise exports.


Free

This plugin is free!

plugins.name: Timesaver: Conditionally Select, Rename, Export, Delete, Duplicate
plugins.description:
The plugin code is open-sourced on Github https://github.com/fireinureeyes/figma-timesaver-plugin


Stop doing things one by one and save time instead

Define your custom conditions and quickly filter out any subset of elements across your file.

Then choose one of the actions to bulk process them.


Example use cases

SELECT all groups not using auto layout,

RENAME all frames on the bottom half of the screen (regex allowed),

EXPORT all icons of a specific layer name format,

DELETE all masks or locked elements,

DUPLICATE and collect all components on one page,

or EXPORT A LIST of elements as a CSV file for documentation purposes.

The possibilities are endless...


Freely combine more than 80 properties to get what you need

Use logical AND and OR to build up complex conditions from:

Scope:

  1. Current page
  2. Whole document
  3. Existing selection


Object type:

  1. Components
  2. Instances
  3. Texts
  4. Shapes (rectangles, stars, lines, polygons...)
  5. Sections
  6. Vectors
  7. Groups
  8. Frames
  9. Boolean operations (unions, substracts, intersects, excludes)


General object properties:

  1. Layer name
  2. Page name
  3. Width
  4. Height
  5. X-Coordinate
  6. Y-Coordinate
  7. Visibility
  8. Rotation
  9. Number of children
  10. Nested level
  11. Number of points (paths)
  12. Locked state
  13. Mask state
  14. Export setting
  15. Overridden properties


Appearance:

  1. Rounding
  2. Fill
  3. Stroke
  4. Stroke color
  5. Opacity
  6. Blendmode
  7. Fill blendmode
  8. Fill opacity
  9. Fill visibility
  10. Stroke opacity
  11. Stroke blendmode
  12. Stroke visiblity
  13. Stroke type
  14. Stroke alignment


Effects:

  1. Drop shadow active
  2. Drop shadow x-offset
  3. Drop shadow y-offset
  4. Drop shadow blur
  5. Drop shadow spread
  6. Drop shadow color
  7. Drop shadow blendmode
  8. Inner shadow active
  9. Inner shadow x-offset
  10. Inner shadow y-offset
  11. Inner shadow blur
  12. Inner shadow spread
  13. Inner shadow color
  14. Inner shadow blendmode
  15. Layer blur active
  16. Background blur active


Text:

  1. Font name
  2. Font size
  3. Line height
  4. Letter spacing
  5. Font weight
  6. Horizontal alignment type
  7. Vertical alignment type
  8. Text decoration underline
  9. Text decoration strikethrough
  10. Paragraph indentation
  11. Paragraph spacing


Auto layout:

  1. Auto layout active
  2. Position
  3. Direction
  4. Item spacing
  5. Padding top
  6. Padding bottom
  7. Padding left
  8. Padding Right


Interaction:

  1. Interaction active
  2. Interaction trigger
  3. Interaction action
  4. Flow starting point


Or narrow down your selection manually from the results list. Clicking on the results will locate the elements on the canvas, so you can easily see what is being adjusted before executing the action.


Renaming supports the following variables:

  1. {id} - unique number
  2. {name} - original layer name
  3. {page} - name of the page where the layer is located
  4. {date} - current date in a YYYY-MM-DD format
  5. {alphabet} - letter sequence a-z
plugins.tagline: Define your custom conditions and quickly filter out any subset of elements across your file.

Intro

Create stunning colour palettes or find perfect colour combinations especially the right shades of greys, tailor-made for every project in seconds.


Whether you're starting out, especially if you‚Äôre starting out or a seasoned pro, use Tinte to generate colours, shades and all the greys you need for your projects ‚Äî websites, apps etc. 


And with Tinte, you get the Hex, HSL and RGB codes.


How to Use?

You can use Tinte in two ways;


1. If you have a base colour code, just input the colour code in to the text prompt and Tinte will do the rest.


2. If you don‚Äôt have a colour code, don‚Äôt worry, you can still use Tinte. All you have to do is provide some information about your project and Tinte will have options for you in seconds. 


Privacy

We do not retain or store your palettes. 


Support

This is the first version of Tinte, so please leave us all your feedback and support. We will appreciate it.


If you face any issues or want to request for features, please let us know in the comments or by filling this form.

plugins.name: CTRL Var: Rename Variables
plugins.description:
Finally, CMD/CTRL + R for variables!

CTRL Var was built to give you many of the same renaming features available for layers - for variables.


Preview your changes

Easily view the variables in your collections, search results, and potential changes before updating.

  1. Scrollable list let's you see the full list and long path names.
  2. Change counts provided to help confirm the impact of the changes.


Search your variable tables

Use the search field to find variable names within a collection.

  1. Easily identify location, patterns, and inconsistencies.
  2. Search has no impact on changes - just a needed feature.


Set the scope of your name changes

Use the scope field to set a path to a specific group, which will limit changes to variables within it.

  1. Scoping must start from the beginning of the path to a group of variables.


Rename part of a variable's name

Use the match field to find a character or word to be replaced with something from the rename field.


Cut text before or after

Remove all text from before or after the matching text

Use the X ‚Üí / X ‚Üê buttons or enter these short codes in the rename field:

  1. #!* (before)
  2. #*! (after).


Add incrementing numbers to your variables

Use the # ‚Üë / # ‚Üì buttons to enter ascending or descending numbers to matching variables names. You can also use these short codes in the rename field:

  1. #>> (ascending from top)
  2. #<< (descending to bottom)
  3. Use the number field to control which number to start or end with
  4. The number of < or > characters signifies the number of digits to be used. For example < is 1, << is 01, <<< is 001, etc.


Limitations

  1. Variables do not allow { } . $
  2. Variable names must be unique, no duplicates
  3. There is a chance the use of some special characters within your variables, such as # & < > * ! may have issues using certain short codes which contain those same characters.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Rename variables like layers, CTRL/CMD + R style!

plugins.name: Moospire
plugins.description:
Description for Moospire Figma Plugin;

Moospire‚Äôs Figma plugin is designed to revolutionize how you create and curate moodboards. Whether you're sourcing inspiration from the web or harnessing the power of AI to bring your unique visions to life, this plugin is ideal for designers seeking an efficient way to visualize and consolidate design concepts directly within your Figma projects.


What to Expect from the Moospire Figma Plugin

1. Seamless Web Curation:

This feature allows you to explore and curate moodboards by compiling the most inspiring and relevant content found across the web. Whether you're looking for design trends, color schemes, or visual ideas, Moospire makes it easy to gather these elements directly into your Figma workspace.


2. AI-Powered Creation:

Transform your thoughts into beautifully cohesive moodboards with just a few clicks. Submit your concepts via text, images, sketches, or even voice notes, and watch as Moospire‚Äôs AI effortlessly crafts these inputs into structured moodboards. This feature is particularly beneficial for capturing the essence of spontaneous ideas and turning them into actionable designs.


How to Use the Moospire Figma Plugin

Installation: Begin by installing the Moospire plugin from the Figma plugin store.

Launching Moospire: Access Moospire directly within your Figma project by navigating to the plugin section and selecting Moospire.

Searching and Curating: Use the search feature to find web content or let Moospire suggest materials based on search & past preferences.

Creating with AI: Upload your creative inputs through the plugin‚Äôs interface, and specify the type of moodboard content you need. The AI will process your inputs and generate a moodboard ideas right within your Figma canvas.
plugins.tagline: The Spark you need to create
